strings.Value: "What is this person of special value you mentioned?"
"I will do what I can. Where is this dungeon?"

"{mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}! I know I already owe you so much, and shouldn't bother you with any further requests – and I would hold my tongue if only my own interests were on the line. However this matter I need help with involves the fate of my people, and a certain person of special value to me."

"You see, when strange events started to occur in Varnhold and its environs, we started our own investigation. We discovered a certain mysterious dungeon – the locals say it was the tomb of an ancient creature of great power. Alas, this turned out to be a false lead, and the dungeon was a trap. Meanwhile, the real Vordakai continued to commit outrages in his real tomb, and then attacked Varnhold."

"As fate would have it, at the moment of the magical attack on the town, a party of my people was inside this false dungeon. And I have yet to learn anything of their fate. This is my request: help me go down into the dungeon, and find out what happened to my people."

"My General and my right hand." {n}Maegar grows grim.{/n} "To think that I, as a leader, brought trouble upon my most loyal people. To be honest, I don't believe I'll find them alive. But I must at least try to find out what happened there."

"The woman who I hope may become my wife." {n}Maegar's eyes grow dark, giving away a storm of hidden emotions.{/n} "She led the party that disappeared into the dungeon. My 'brilliant' orders landed her in trouble, and I still don't even know what happened down there."

"I will mark it on a map." {n}Maegar nods shortly and gratefully.{/n} "I will meet you on the road, if you decide to go. Thank you, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}. This mission... is very important to me."

{n}Maegar frowns, but answers calmly in a neutral tone.{/n} "That is your right. I cannot leave this issue unattended, and will try to organize an expedition into the dungeon on my own. But I won't disturb you with this any further. Have a good day, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}!"

"My General and my right hand." {n}Maegar grows grim.{/n} "To think that I, as a leader, brought trouble upon my most loyal people. To be honest, I don't believe I'll find them alive. But I must at least try to find out what happened there."
